cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving north tonight then accelerating north-northeast toward the northern Gulf Coast, crossing the Southeast U.S., and exiting the Mid-Atlantic coast into the Atlantic Ocean by early Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northern Gulf Coast near southeast Louisiana / Mississippi coastline

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, Louisiana
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City LA to MS/AL border; Storm Surge Warning Mouth of the Atchafalaya River LA to Navarre FL; Tropical Storm Warning MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton County line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL-FL Panhandle) then inland Southeast and the Mid-Atlantic coastline including Chesapeake Bay/Delmarva
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possible (totals in the 2–4 inch range with isolated 4+ inches)
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds 25–40 mph possible late Thursday into early Friday with low (10%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal anomalies (<2 ft) possible in upper Chesapeake Bay; significant surge (>3 ft) not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain could cause urban and small-stream flooding Thursday–Friday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornado threat over the Mid-Atlantic Thursday; reduced visibility and potential debris affecting port operations
